component.name: AlertDialog
component.description: Modal dialog for confirming destructive or critical actions before proceeding.

useCases: Confirming destructive actions like deletion or account removal
Requiring user acknowledgment before irreversible operations
Presenting critical information that must be dismissed before continuing
Two-step confirmation flows for sensitive changes

commonPatterns.name: delete-confirmation
commonPatterns.description: Standard destructive action confirmation with cancel and delete buttons
commonPatterns.composition:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild><Button variant="destructive">Delete Item</Button></AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent>
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Are you sure?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the item.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>Cancel</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction variant="destructive">Delete</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

commonPatterns.name: with-media-icon
commonPatterns.description: Alert dialog with a media icon for visual context
commonPatterns.composition:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild><Button variant="outline">Disconnect</Button></AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent>
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogMedia><Unplug /></AlertDialogMedia>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Disconnect account?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>You will need to re-authenticate to reconnect.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>Keep Connected</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction variant="destructive">Disconnect</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

commonPatterns.name: small-size
commonPatterns.description: Compact dialog for simple yes/no confirmations
commonPatterns.composition:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild><Button variant="ghost" size="sm">Remove</Button></AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent size="sm">
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Remove this item?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>This cannot be undone.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>No</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction variant="destructive">Yes, Remove</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

antiPatterns.scenario: Using AlertDialog for non-destructive information display
antiPatterns.reason: AlertDialog forces user interaction; informational content should not block the user
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a standard Dialog or Sheet for non-blocking information

antiPatterns.scenario: Using AlertDialog for forms or complex input
antiPatterns.reason: AlertDialog is designed for simple confirm/cancel flows, not multi-field forms
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Dialog or Sheet for forms

antiPatterns.reason: Users must always have a way to back out of destructive actions

slots.trigger: AlertDialogTrigger wrapping the element that opens the dialog
slots.media: AlertDialogMedia for an icon or image in the header
slots.title: AlertDialogTitle for the dialog heading
slots.footer: AlertDialogFooter containing action and cancel buttons

parentConstraints: AlertDialogAction and AlertDialogCancel must be inside AlertDialogFooter

interactions.open: Overlay fades in with backdrop blur; content zooms in with fade
interactions.close: Content zooms out with fade; overlay fades out
interactions.cancel: Dismisses the dialog without executing the action
interactions.action: Executes the confirmed action and closes the dialog

responsive.mobile: Centered modal; footer stacks buttons vertically (column-reverse)
responsive.desktop: Centered modal; sm size max-width xs, default size max-width lg; footer buttons inline

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Escape to close (cancel); Tab to cycle focus within dialog; Enter/Space to activate buttons
accessibility.screenReader: Announced as an alert dialog with title and description; focus trapped within content
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus is trapped inside the dialog when open; returns to trigger element on close

rules: Always pair AlertDialogAction with AlertDialogCancel for user safety
Use variant='destructive' on AlertDialogAction for destructive confirmations
AlertDialogAction defaults to variant='primary' and size='sm'; AlertDialogCancel defaults to variant='outline' and size='sm'
Use size='sm' for simple yes/no confirmations; default size for detailed explanations
Include AlertDialogDescription for screen reader context even if visually brief
Uses GlassFrame wrapper for frosted glass container effect

aiHints.context: Use exclusively for confirming destructive or irreversible actions. This is a blocking modal that requires explicit user acknowledgment. For non-destructive modals, use Dialog or Sheet. For inline messages, use Alert.
